newsitem.title: USA: U.S. West Coast spot gasoline tracks higher NYMEX.
newsitem.headline: U.S. West Coast spot gasoline tracks higher NYMEX.

text.p: Wholesale prices for U.S. West Coast gasoline tracked rises in New York futures Monday, while local activity remained thin ahead of tomorrow's inventory report from the American Petroleum Institute (API).
The market was light in typical Monday fashion, traders said. Some hoped a 0.53 cent-rise in August unleaded gasoline would pull West Coast prices out of a long flat spell.
"It's strengthening, but traders are wary of the (API) numbers that could come out tomorrow," one broker said.
Offers for Los Angeles CARB gasoline rose one cent a gallon to 57 cents Monday, traders said, with deals heard done at 56.50 cents.
Buyers of conventional grade gasoline, for sale in Reno, Nevada, offered to pay 53 cents a gallon, a one cent rise from Friday bids, traders said.
